description: 5-minute oral presentation on a research article discussing functional analysis of a gene, followed by 5-minute Q&A. Assesses critical evaluation and communication of experimental findings.

Written scientific report (4-page maximum) summarizing bioinformatics findings about a gene using tools introduced in practical sessions. Focuses on DNA sequence variation and epigenetic regulation analysis.
2-hour written test with essay questions covering lecture and practical material from Weeks 1-4. Assesses understanding of genome structure, sequencing technologies, and genetic testing methods.
2-hour written examination during formal exam period with essay questions covering Weeks 7-10 content. Tests understanding of human genomics, sequencing impacts, and genetic disease research methods.
